title: @Riot Taric Rework
body:
As we all know our beloved (bejeweled) support is getting a Sion level rework.

When Sion was getting his rework he transformed into almost entirely new champion:
- new lore,
- new model,
- VO,
- skills...
Thats because his old version was not matching his archetype as an undead death machine.
He was just this herpy derpy, not so living, Arnoldy thing.
But Riot not only created almost new champion but also keept the most iconic parts of his former self:
- his axe,
- W shield,
- hp stacking,
- lifesteal berserker mode via passive.
All this combined together to what we often call "the best rework ever".

Now about Taric.{{champion:44}} 
What bothers me the most is that, unlike Sion, his current version matches his paladin, knight, ge(m)omancer archetype quite well.
Ofc his model is ugly (sorry Taric) and his lore sucks :D but all in all he is quite unique champion.
He is the only fighter-support in game (imo he fits perfectly into juggernaut category -  powerful, durable, immobile and melee).
He grant his team powerful auras, can shred armor, keep one of last point-and-click cc in game, got double-edged heal.
Also his character is one of the most unique - always calm, gentle, always by your side, but also in his voice you can hear some king of saddnes (his voice actor done great job).
He is like an artist-knight-protector.

Here is a list of thing that I find core for Taric:
- character (Sion's character changed completely in his rework),
- hammer and shield,
- bejeweled heavy, plate armor.
- heal,
- armor aura,
- stun of some kind,
- aoe boost for his team,
- armor scalings,
- lack of mobility,
- fighter (not a tank) gamestyle,
- solo top and jungle potential :D.

So here is my question, Riot:
**What from this list you gonna keep in his rework?**
Im not asking about his new kit, keep your secrets for yourself if you wish.

Thanks for reading. I hope someone will answer me :D.
Love, peace and Gems everyone {{champion:44}} .

I just wanted to note my agreement here. "Magic has ruined this land." is one of his best quotes. It may not make sense in the post-Retcon universe, which may or may not have ever had Rune Wars, but I do really like that quote. I think Taric is very distinctive as a mature, measured, somewhat somber (but not broody/angsty/emo) character, in a sea of "I am a maladjusted 20-year-old with a DEATHBLADE and a thirst for VENGEANCE and my eyes glow purple!" characters. If you'll pardon the pun, Taric is very grounded. And he's not pumped to the gills with testosterone, steroids, and murderjuice the way some Champions are.
When you say, **only fighter-support** I can't figure out if that means the **only ** fighter/support or he is **only** a fighter/support.

he means The only fighter/support.

Right now, Taric plays with a rhythm that actually matches someone like Lee sin (mix between spells and AAs) and is primarily focused on getting stuck-in in a fight and dishing out the hurt rather than just peeling allies or initiating. his damage is what scales hardest on him (odd though that may sound) and he is only *tanky*, not an actual *tank* (sort of like how Garen and Darius are super tanky but fighters because they primarily deal damage rather than focus on CC/utility).

Yeah, one of the things that makes Taric work for me is the mindgames that come from seeing him with a K/D score more befitting the toplaner and how people will actually _avoid_ the ADC/support team rather than try to dive the backline. He does really well with Marksmen who don't need as much peel and have built-in escapes, since Taric really feels like he needs to be up front and getting stuck in.
Yeah, he works well with someone safe like Tristana, since he can leave her pretty much alone and go smack people.
